title: WCAS SOCIOL 476-0-21 Topics in Sociological Analysis

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Inequalities, their varied forms, reproduction, transformations and, potentially, eradication - have been core concerns of sociology since its inception as a discipline. However, attention to the particular dimension of class has grown dramatically in recent years, both in sociology and in other social science disciplines. In this seminar, we take an interdisciplinary approach and integrate this newer focus on class with ongoing research on other dimensions of inequality. We also focus on the role of politics - broadly construed to include systems of beliefs and ideology, culture, electoral systems, social movements, states - in creating, sustaining or eroding inequalities of various kinds.
